jobDescription: Chancellor's Office StatementJoin our team at the California State University, Office of the Chancellor, and make a difference in providing access to higher education. We are currently seeking experienced candidates for the position of Director, Cloud Data Engineering.The CSU Chancellor's Office, located on the waterfront adjacent to the Aquarium of the Pacific in downtown Long Beach, is the headquarters for the nation's largest and most diverse system of higher education. The CSU Chancellor's Office offers a premium benefit package that includes outstanding vacation, health, and dental plans; a fee waiver education program; membership in the California Public Employees Retirement System (PERS); and 14 paid holidays a year.SalaryCommensurate with qualifications and experience.Position InformationThe California State University, Office of the Chancellor, is seeking a Director, Cloud Data Engineering to will lead the enterprise data warehouse team and will help steer strategic technology direction, define reference architectures for data acquisition, storage and distribution, business intelligence/data warehousing, metadata management, data quality management, data modeling and MDM. The Director, Cloud Data Engineering will both mentor and lead others while championing and maturing the enterprise cloud data practice. This role will serve as a senior advisor to the CDO.ResponsibilitiesUnder the general direction of the Chief Data Officer, the Director, Cloud Data Engineering will: Perform a key leadership and mentorship role in the areas of advanced data techniques, including data modeling, data access, data integration, data visualization, data discovery, statistical methods, database design and implementation involving cloud-based, traditional and hybrid architectures.Create and maintain responsibility for the overall design of the enterprise-wide data architecture leveraging a range of new design techniques to ensure high levels of speed, effectiveness and availability across platforms.Establish analytic environments required for structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data.Identify information challenges and opportunities within CSU and develop innovative data architecture solutions that can assist with these challenges.Manage current and future data architecture, design, and content needs while producing design and development guidelines to ensure a consistent and highly effective data infrastructure.Collaborate with other technical resources including Infrastructure, database administration, operations, identity management, information security, web development and project management to ensure effective communication and prioritization across project areas.Collaborate with data governance and subject-area experts in order to interpret requirements and define subject area models aligned with enterprise operations.Develop processes for capturing and maintaining metadata from all data components to build a comprehensive meta-model.Develop knowledge of innovative industry-leading practices and products and explore opportunities to apply these innovations within CSU.QualificationsThis position requires:
